text: I don't know, and therefore I can clearly never log off Twitter.
author: MahaRafiAtal

text:
Me: Hurray, Friday evening, I will go home, cook a giant pot of soup and reward myself with Netflix and not reading the news. 

Bob Mueller: LOL nice try.
author: MahaRafiAtal

text: Fellow thoroughly biased Pembrokian here. Warren has the absolute best policy shop in the field, but he's not far behind on substance, and too many of the rest are just flimsy.
author: MahaRafiAtal

text: A long time ago, in my past life as an aspiring Victorianist, @william_whyte's lectures were among the highlights of my week. So pleased he's hiring a postdoc to work with him researching the colonial past of his own Oxford college. More of this please!
author: MahaRafiAtal

text: I once sat on a departmental equality committee which ran a survey for people to share stories of discrimination to gauge the problem. TONS of responses like "I, a white man, did not get a job that a woman was also up for. I am the true victim, and your committee is bullying me."
author: MahaRafiAtal

text: 10:55pm. Deadline is midnight CET not GMT.
author: MahaRafiAtal

text: We are all just scrambling for shards of solace these days.
author: MahaRafiAtal

text: Honestly I learned more from Clint yelling at a chair than I learned from the PM just now.
author: MahaRafiAtal

text: Every time they show that empty lectern in Downing St I think of this:
author: MahaRafiAtal

text: Testament to how insane everything is that I first read this as the year 2030.
author: MahaRafiAtal

text: NB Umunna would be the only PoC at that table and "not a proper X" is yucky language from an old white dude in that context, regardless of what one thinks of the Independent Group as a project.
author: MahaRafiAtal

text: Eww. Yeah, see also news coverage of the too common form "Young man accused of rape. What a tragedy. This will be terrible for *his* career."
author: MahaRafiAtal

text: Tech investors inserting #metoo clauses into due diligence. On one hand, I'm glad execs are being made to disclose this. On the other, I do not like framing "risk" of harassment as risk to the firm without acknowledging the risk and harm *to the victims*.
author: MahaRafiAtal

text: I would watch this. I feel like the late Terry Pratchett ought to have written it, and I am not sure who does that sort of thing nowadays, but I'd watch.
author: MahaRafiAtal
